results.title: Sulfonylurea antidiabetics are associated with lower risk of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: Real-world data from a population-based study
results.text_hl: Thus, individuals who only used @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ in the 90 days prior to index date and an @<m>DISEASE_Out_of_Hospital_Cardiac_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058687 @@@OHCA@@@ occurred were classified in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ group.

citations.NLM: Eroglu TE, Jia L, Blom MT, Verkerk AO, Devalla HD, Boink GJJ, Souverein PC, de Boer A, Tan HL. Sulfonylurea antidiabetics are associated with lower risk of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: Real-world data from a population-based study Br J Clin Pharmacol. 2021 Sep;87(9):3588-3598. PMID: 33896015
citations.BibTeX: @article{33896015, title={Sulfonylurea antidiabetics are associated with lower risk of out-of-hospital cardiac arrest: Real-world data from a population-based study}, author={Eroglu TE and Jia L and Blom MT and Verkerk AO and Devalla HD and Boink GJJ and Souverein PC and de Boer A and Tan HL}, journal={Br J Clin Pharmacol}, volume={87}, number={9}, pages={3588-3598}}

results.title: Association between metformin and survival outcomes in in-hospital cardiac arrest patients with diabetes.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: In @<m>DISEASE_Out_of_Hospital_Cardiac_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058687 @@@IHCA@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with @DISEASE_Myotonic_Dystrophy @DISEASE_MESH:D009223 @@@T2DM@@@, administration of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ within 24 h before @<m>DISEASE_Out_of_Hospital_Cardiac_Arrest</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D058687 @@@IHCA@@@ was independently associated with survival to discharge.

citations.NLM: Jin BY, Song J, Kim J, Park JH, Kim SJ, Cho H, Moon S, Kim DH, Ahn S. Association between metformin and survival outcomes in in-hospital cardiac arrest patients with diabetes. J Crit Care. 2023 Feb;73():154171. PMID: 36279760
